main_definition: Light can refer to the natural agent that stimulates sight and makes things visible, or it can be used as an idiom with various meanings.

meanings_and_examples.example: She lit a candle to brighten up the room.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Not heavy; easy to lift or carry
meanings_and_examples.example: The backpack was light, so I could easily carry it on my hike.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Of little importance or seriousness; trivial
meanings_and_examples.example: He dismissed her complaints as just light concerns.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Fully aware of the facts and reality of a situation
meanings_and_examples.example: She knew all about his plans, she was very much in the light on the matter.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An expression that indicates surprise or sudden understanding
meanings_and_examples.example: I'm not sure what you mean; it's all just light to me.
